intro: Triticum venulosum, commonly known as the slender wheatgrass, is a species of grass native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with numerous tiny flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and agricultural research.
